did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Harris L. Kimball papers, circa 1973-2003.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records of the landmark cases in which Mr. Kimball represented various clients and other files and ephemera about Kimball.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Harris L. Kimball was the first openly gay attorney in the US. In 1955, while working as a civil rights lawyer in Florida, he was arrested for "lewd and lascivious conduct" with another man. He was disbarred on September 6, 1957. On July 3, 1973, the New York Court of Appeals found Kimball to be of good character and qualified to practice law in New York State. In "Sexuality and the Law: An Encyclopedia of Major Legal Cases" (Garland, 1993), Arthur S. Leonard highlights the significant role this decision by the NY Court of Appeals played "in the gradual recognition that lesbian and gay people were entitled to full citizenship rights in a diverse society."

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records of the landmark cases in which Mr. Kimball represented various clients and other files and ephemera about Kimball.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Harris L. Kimball papers, #7823. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series I. Florida Bar Disbarment Court Case Related Materials
Series II. New York State Bar Related Materials
Series III. Assorted Court Case Materials
Series IV. Assorted Correspondence and Writing

did.unittitle: Florida Bar Disbarment Court Case Related Materials
State of Florida/Florida Bar v. Kimball Documents

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous loose documents and a fragmentary bound document

did.unittitle: Florida Bar v. Kimball

scopecontent.p: Report of the Florida Bar Grievance Committee for the Ninth Judicial Circuit regarding the Florida Bar v. Harris Kimball (photocopy)

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar et al. - Case No. 74-688-Civ-NCR(WM) Court Documents

scopecontent.p: Assorted documents from both the plaintiff, Harris Kimball, and the defendents, The Florida Bar, et al., including a notice of appeal to the Fifth Circuit court.

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar et al. - Case No. 75-1005 (Fifth Circuit) Court Documents

scopecontent.p: Assorted documents from both the appellant Harris Kimball, and the appellees, The Florida Bar, et al., including a copy of the Appellant's Appendix and photocopies from Law Journals on the case's outcome

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar et al. - Case No. 74-668-Civ-NCR Court Documents

scopecontent.p: Assorted documents from both the plaintiff, Harris Kimball, and the defendents, The Florida Bar, et al.; also included are photocopies of the verdict from the Federal Case Reporter 'Federal Supplement'

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar et al. - Case No. 79-1781 Court Documents

scopecontent.p: Assorted documents from both the appellant Harris Kimball, and the appellees, The Florida Bar, et al., including a transcript from the court and an excerpt of records

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar - Case No. CRE82001(60,831)

scopecontent.p: Documents from Kimball's petition for reinstatement to the Florida Bar

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar - Case No. CRE82001(60,831)

scopecontent.p: A petition for review opened by Kimball against the Florida Bar

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Mostly between Harris Kimball and his attorneys, Louis Jepeway and Jeremiah Gutman, regarding Kimball's case against the Florida Bar over his disbarrment and petition for reinstatement.

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Mostly between Harris Kimball and his attorneys, Louis Jepeway and Jeremiah Gutman, regarding Kimball's case against the Florida Bar over his disbarrment and petition for reinstatement.

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Mostly between Harris Kimball and his attorneys, Louis Jepeway and Jeremiah Gutman, regarding Kimball's case against the Florida Bar over his disbarrment and petition for reinstatement.

did.unittitle: Kimball v. Florida Bar Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Mostly between Harris Kimball and his attorneys, Louis Jepeway and Jeremiah Gutman, regarding Kimball's case against the Florida Bar over his disbarrment and petition for reinstatement.

did.unittitle: Reference statutes and cases - Reinstatement Petition of Harris Kimball

scopecontent.p: Includes a respondent brief from The Florida Bar v. Ronald Kay (Case No. 38,694); an amicus curiae from Joseph Acanfora v. Board of Education of Montgomery County, et al.; and documents from Case No. 59,238 (Florida Board of Bar Examiners: in re N.R.S)

did.unittitle: The Florida Bar Reinstatement Manual - March 1981
New York State Bar Related Materials
New York State Bar Admission Petition Court Documents

scopecontent.p: Documents from Kimball's application to the New York Bar; includes the stenographer's minutes from May 31, 1972.

did.unittitle: New York State Bar Admission Petition Court Documents
New York State Bar Application - Appendix (Original)

scopecontent.p: A fragmentary bound edition of the appendix from Kimball's petition to the New York State Bar

did.unittitle: New York State Bar Application - Appendix (Photocopy)
New York State Bar Admission Petition Court Documents

scopecontent.p: Includes documents from 1974 and undated items associated with Kimball's petition for admission to the New York State Bar

did.unittitle: New York State Bar Admission Petition Correspondence and Documents

scopecontent.p: Contains copies of Kimball's various verdicts regarding his admission to the New York State Bar as seen in the Appellate Division Reports, 2d Series; the New York Reports, 2d Series; and the New York State Law Digest

did.unittitle: Reference statutes and cases - New York State Bar Admission Petitiom
Certificate from the New York State Eastern District Court

scopecontent.p: Issued by the Eastern District of New York State, signed by Lewis Orgel on April 5, 1974, to Harris Kimball; verifies that Kimball was admitted and qualified as an Attorney and Counselor to the Eastern District of New York State

did.unittitle: Certificate from the New York State Southern District Court

scopecontent.p: Issued by the Southern District of New York State, signed by Raymond Burghardt on April 04, 1974, to Harris Kimball; verifies that Kimball was admitted and qualified as an Attorney and Counselor to the Southern District of New York State

did.unittitle: Westchester County Bar Association 1987-1988 Pictorial Directory

scopecontent.p: Harris Kimball is listed on page 68 and 118

scopecontent.p: Documents and correspondence regarding Clark's individual case against the state of New York

Joseph P.' and 'Donald B.' Documents and Correspondence
Assorted Spinelli and Stra Documents and Correspondence
White Plains Railroad Station Arrests Documents and Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous items associated with the case against Peter Sidone in Port Chester, NY

did.unittitle: The People of NYS v. Michael Garr Documents
Michael Garr v. State of New York Court Documents
Assorted Michael Garr Documents

scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of the Last Will and Testement of Michael Garr and various correspondence regarding Michael Garr v. State

did.unittitle: Ardsley Service Area Assorted

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous photographs, newspaper articles, and transcriptions of telephone conversations regarding the Ardsley Service Area arrests and trials

did.unittitle: Gay Activists Alliance Court Documents and Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Includes court documents regarding the GAA picketing a private residence, newspaper clippings, various correspondence, and the documents' original folder with notes.

did.unittitle: Thomas Kingman Miscellaneous Documents and Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of the interview with Thomas Kingman from August 21, 1978, newspaper clippings, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Gretchen Grant v. John Doyle et al. Court Documents
Assorted Cases

scopecontent.p: Includes documents and/or correspondence from "The People of the State of New York State v. Wei Chen", "Joseph Harmon v. James Reap", "The People of the State of New York v. John Colern", "The People of the State of New York v. Evelyn Gutherie", "The People of the State of New York v. Peter Cannizzaro", "The People of the State of New York v. Stuart Heller and Donald Paschall", and a letter from Danny Mauariky(?),

did.unittitle: Reference Cases and Statutes
Assorted Correspondence and Writing
Miscellaneous Notes

scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes spanning Kimball's career on assorted topics; most are undated

did.unittitle: Sodomy and the Constitution (c.1975)

scopecontent.p: An excerpt of Sodomy and the Constitution by Walter Barnett prepared by Kimball in 1987, which is missing page 46

did.unittitle: Sodomy and the Constitution Footnotes

scopecontent.p: The footnotes for the excerpt of Sodomy and the Constitution by Walter Barnett; also included is a section of a Memorandum of Law on homosexuals, which Kimball derived from Sodomy and the Constitution

did.unittitle: "The Emerging Gay Lawyer" Correspondendce and Drafts

scopecontent.p: Articles either relating to Harris Kimball, his cases and clients, or to homosexuality (in the workplace, the perception of, etc.).

did.unittitle: WBAI Radio Documents and Correspondence

scopecontent.p: Folio editions from November 1984, December 1984, January 1985 (x2), March 1985, April 1985, March 1986, September 1986, and April 1986.

did.unittitle: WBAI Folioand other articles on WBAI Radio
"Harris L. Kimball: America's 'First' Gay Lawyer" drafts
"An American Original." Harris Kimball (Short Excerpts)

scopecontent.p: Contains three excerpts from "An American Original" with Kimball's brief intro and copies of his correspondence with a Wall Street Journal Editor

did.unittitle: Excerpt from "An American Original"
"The Abominable and Detestable Crime"

scopecontent.p: A draft copy of the article with both editor notation and author notes for future edits

did.unittitle: Harris Kimball Memoir

scopecontent.p: Email correspondence between Harris Kimball and Robert Herrig(?) regarding Kimball's memoir and some mention of Kimball's will; working drafts for the memoir; research articles on memoir writing

did.unittitle: Assorted Materials
Tabula 1944, Oak Park and River Forest Township Highschool yearbook

scopecontent.p: Harris Kimball's highschool yearbook from his senior year, including a 'Program of Special Services for Class of 1944';

did.unittitle: Portrait of Harris Kimball

scopecontent.p: Possibly his senior portrait, taken at Toloff Studios in Evanston/Oak Park, Illinois

did.unittitle: Diploma from University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign awarded to Harris Kimball

scopecontent.p: Awarding the degree of Juris Doctor on February 1, 1968; issued to replace an LL.B. degree awarded August 20, 1951

did.unittitle: Certificate from the United States Tax Court awarded to Harris Kimball

scopecontent.p: Issued by Howard Dawson, Jr granting permission for Harris Kimball to practice in the United States Tax Court

did.unittitle: Legal Observer armband

scopecontent.p: Armband with 'LEGAL OBSERVER' written with patches, with lambda-esque patches to the right and left of 'LEGAL"; the item itself is made of demin and black felt; the article appears handstitched

did.unittitle: T-Shirt with iron-on transfer of a news article

scopecontent.p: The article is from the New York Times: June 27, 2003, " Justices, 6-3, Legalizes Gay Sexual Conduct in Sweeping Reversal of Court's '86 Ruling"
